column4: I've recently aquired a live disk from one of my teachers, and I tried to install it on an old laptop (it was dropped, spits out the OS NOT FOUND error.) I get to the Ubuntu startup and say run/install or something of the like and then it starts to boot/install. However, once it gets to "Configuring X" it seems to shut down and goes back to a blank blinking prompt. No keys then work and it has to be restarted. Any ideas?
when you say 'old' laptop how old are we talking.. PII ?
hmm not too bad. when you boot look at the boot options, could try different video settings.
In the other options? as in when I press f6?
yeah, look for video related options
what laptop is it? brand,model, etc
looking here to see if anything will help http://www.linux-on-laptops.com/compaq.html
have you tried F4 on boot?
give F4 a shot on boot.
The second option a Safe Graphics Mode?

there's probably a way to start the boot cd without X but I think if the boot CD doesn't detect your screen it's going to be a bit of a hassle to get it setup. It's probably some issue with the video card.
